title: Serif ID
content:
Does anyone know what typeface is this? It is used in the Human Being Journals from Need Supply Co.

I can't attach an image for some reason but here's a link:

[http://humanbeing.co/images/list.svg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070437/http:/humanbeing.co/images/list.svg "http://humanbeing.co/images/list.svg")

Thanks in advance!

Font: 

 Larish Neue 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070437/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: davidgtz

comments.content:
The sans is Apercu, by Colophon:  
 [http://www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/apercu/about-font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070437/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/apercu/about-font "http://www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/apercu/about-font")

So I thought the serif might be another Colophon typeface, but Value—while similar—isn’t a match:  
 [http://www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/value/serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070437/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/value/serif "http://www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/value/serif")

Still searching for it....

No luck with database searches. I’m betting that it is also from an independent foundry; the |W|s (upper and lowercase) are certainly distinctive, as is the |f|.

I’m sure someone else will be able to pin it down for you....
Thank you very much! Actually I can use Fortescue, it fits with what I'm doing, thanks again. If someone knows that font though I'd appreciate it.
Serif you're after is [Larish Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317070437/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-neue) by Radim Peško.
